equivalent.translation[0].definitions[0]: having the same value, purpose, job etc as a person or thing of a different kind
I had no dollars, but offered him an equivalent amount of sterling.
a qualification which is equivalent to a degree
equivalent.translation[1].definitions[0]: something that has the same value, purpose, job etc as something else
The word has no equivalent in English.
He had drunk the equivalent of 15 whiskies.
equivalent.translation[1].note_box[0].se: The word has no direct equivalent in English.
The corner store was the closest equivalent we had to a supermarket when I was young.
Horror films are the modern-day equivalent of morality tales.
Savings and loan associations are the American equivalent of Britainâ€™s building societies.
This institution has no equivalent in any other European country.
equivalent.translation[2].definitions[0]: something that is equal in value, amount, quality etc to something else
The Japanese bank had the equivalent of $131 billion in assets on March 31.
